messages.message:
Revisiting @Xindi Xu’s #3 idea to add a label to still run a test in CI but have it not block merging -

We obviously need to use it sparingly, but I actually really like this idea for the specific case of new tests. We recently added tests for deployments, advanced apps, and review, and we ended up seeing issues with concurrency and sheer volume that we couldn't have anticipated from testing locally. We can think of new tests as having a "baking" period where we want to see the results but they shouldn't be blocking. Thoughts?

apologies for just jumping in here :sweat_smile: extending ^ further, what about adding a check in the github action to look for the label _and_ only honor it if the PR belongs to a user in some controlled "admin" group or something? that way we can guarantee only the frontend devs working on this stuff have the ability to skip?

i think Jessica’s suggestion was that by default, we should ignore failures for tests that are considered “new” -> and at some point, when we think the test is stable/reliable, we’ll remove this special treatment and always require the test to pass in CI

so we’re adding labels to specific Cypress tests, not at the PR level

is that accurate? @Jessica
Yep I chatted with Xindi and I actually misunderstood her comment! I am indeed proposing we ignore tests at the test level, not the PR level, using the system of tags CJ put together
And I have no idea how technically feasible this is haha. @CJ any thoughts?
pretty feasible, we can match on a string in the pr body, for example
